snippet: Some residents say a plan to name a street after Officer Phillip W. Cardillo, who was fatally shot in a renowned Harlem mosque in 1972, will reopen old wounds, not heal them.
abstract: Harlem residents are divided over a plan to name a street after New York City Police Officer Phillip W Cardillo, who was fatally shot in a neighborhood mosque in 1972; many fear that the honor will reopen old wounds and tensions between African-American Muslims and the police.
lead_paragraph: Some residents say a plan to name a street after Officer Phillip W. Cardillo, who was fatally shot in a renowned Harlem mosque in 1972, will reopen old wounds, not heal them.

headline.seo: Harlem Split on Plan to Honor Officer Killed in ’72
headline.main: Harlem Split on Plan to Honor Officer Killed in Mosque in ’72
headline.print_headline: Harlem Split on Plan to Honor Officer Killed in Mosque in ’72
